Creating a Channel

In this topic, you will learn how to create a channel using the Channels tab in Brightcove Beacon.

Description

Channels are created to stream 24/7 Live events just like a regular TV channel will do, for more information on how to create Live events, please visit the Brightcove Beacon Live Documentation.

Basic Data section

To create a Channel in Brightcove Beacon, follow these steps:

  1. Login to Brightcove Beacon.
  2. In the top navigation, select Channels.
  3. Click the Add new channel button.
  4. In the Basic Data tab, define a Name for your channel.
  5. In the Content Rating dropdown menu, select your channel's content rating based on the Content Rating System of the country where your channel will be streaming. In the example image, it is for the US TV-Y.
  6. In the Genres Details section, click the Genres dropwdown menu to select a genre for your channel. (Example: Horror, Drama, etc..)
  7. If you don’t find the correct genre for your channel, you can create additional ones by clicking the Create Genre button.
    8. The Sub-Genres dropdown menu, is not functional at this time.

Textual Data

The Textual Data section allows you to add displayable text for your Channel.

  1. Select the Textual Data tab.
  2. In the Title field, define a title for your channel.
  3. In the Description field, define a description for your channel.
  4. In the Synopsis field, define a synopsis for your channel.
    5. You can add a Textual Data section for every different language you will use in your channel.

Non-Textual Data

The Non-Textual Data section allows you to add Portrait and Landscape images for your Channel.

  1. Select the Non-Textual Data tab.
  2. Add a Portrait Poster image for your Channel by dragging and dropping the image in the box section.
  3. Add a Landscape Poster image for your Channel by dragging and dropping the image in the box section.
  4. Image Requirements
    Portrait Poster Poster image (2:3)
    Minimum Width: 1000px Height: 563px
    Maximum Width: 4000px Height: 2250px
    Landscape Poster Landscape image (16:9):
    Minimum Width: 1000px Height: 563px
    Maximum Width: 4000px Height: 2250px
    You can add a different Portrait and Landscape set of images for every different language you will use in your channel just by selecting the desired language tab.

Tags

The Tags tab is not functional at this time.

Metadata

The Metadata tab is not functional at this time.

Streams

The Stream section allows you to set the options and permissions for the playback URL.

  1. Select the Streams tab.
  2. Select your Provider. You will most likely only have one provider, which references your Brightcove Video Cloud account.
  3. Click the Add new stream button.
  4. In the Stream Video ID field, paste the Video ID from your Video Cloud Live Event.
  5. In the Devices to publish section, add the devices to which you wish to publish. Select the Select / Unselect All Devices to see a list of available devices.
  6. In the Stream Type select Live.
  7. Note that the DRM Type and Stream Format values do not need to be altered.

Rights & Scheduling

The Rights & Scheduling section is where you set the publish status and availability.

  1. Select the Rights & Scheduling tab.

  2. Be sure the Status is set to Published for your channel.
  3. For the Availability Details, use the following as a guide to complete the information:
    Field Required Notes
    Rights Type Yes Select depending on your monetization model:
    • Free
    • Advertising - AVOD : For Channels monetized with advertising.
    • Subscription - SVOD: For Channels monetized with a subscription.
    Start Time Yes Schedule a starting time for your channel.
    End Time Yes Schedule an end time for your channel.
    Max Streams N/A Not functional at this time.
    Devices to publish Yes Add the devices you wish to publish to. Select the Select/ Unselect All Devices to see a list of available devices.
    Permitted locations Yes Select the locations where you want to stream your content.
    Denied locations No Select the locations where you DO NOT want to stream your content.

    To add or edit geographic locations, navigate to Settings and then Locations.
  4. Be sure to click the Create New Channel button to save your work.

Adding your Channel to an Electronic Program Guide (EPG)

Once your channel has been created, the last step will be to add it to the Brightcove Beacon EPG schedule. For information on how to do this, please visit the Creating an Electronic Program Guide (EPG) documentation.
